alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Jackson; Jefferson; Pottawatomie; Shawnee; Wabaunsee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 14 at 4:27PM CST by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Jefferson, Shawnee, Douglas, northeastern Wabaunsee, eastern Pottawatomie and southern Jackson Counties through 500 PM CST... At 427 PM CST, trained weather spotters reported strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles west of Wamego to 5 miles west of Topeka to near Edgerton. Movement was north at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Topeka, Lawrence, Baldwin City, Wamego, Rossville, Oskaloosa, Westmoreland, Tecumseh, Eudora, St. Marys, Richland, Silver Lake, Perry, McLouth, Meriden, Onaga, Hoyt, Ozawkie, St. George and Lecompton. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 between mile markers 336 and 355. Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 173 and 205. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Douglas; Jackson; Jefferson; Pottawatomie; Shawnee; Wabaunsee
